revised_title: A Method for Meteorological Registration of the Chemical Action of Total Daylight
tldr: The author presents a method for measuring the chemical action of total daylight using a pendulum photometer and standard chloride-of-silver paper. This method allows for regular meteorological registration and can be used to determine the intensity of light and its effects on chemical reactions. The author also discusses the accuracy and trustworthiness of the method, providing results from various observations and measurements.
